result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lori J. Harvey

defendant.name: Harvey, Lori J.
defendant.address: PO Box 1947, c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution #708374, Fond du Lac, WI 54935

records.addlTxt:
10:28 AM Cases 22CF47 and 22CF48 called together.  Defendant Lori J. Harvey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman from Polk County Courthouse for Lori J. Harvey.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Def appearing from Taycheedah Correctional Facility.  State assures VR compliance.  Def waives in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Schmidt: def stipulating to restitution amount in another case not before the court (already done), def pleading to Count 1 of 22CF48-fel bail jump, DRI remainder, joint rec for court costs. $65,197.50 restitution was stipulated to in 20CF91; ADA Schmidt makes record RE: origin of charges and basis for agreement.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 22CF48 and orders a JOC; Counts 2-12 and 22CF47 are DRI.  Def waives PSI KIV.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.   
Court orders:
$10 fine, costs, DNA surcharge.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with clerk of courts; Court may enter a civil judgment against the defendant if she fails to pay.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff.

2:37 PM  Cases 22CF47 & 22CF48 called together. Defendant Lori J. Harvey appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Lori J. Harvey.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court and Court Reporter by video.  Case on for Status Conference.  DA advises State is in compliance with victim's rights.  Atty Chapman states matters will be resolved, she has a couple options to choose from, asks for Plea/Sentencing.  Mr. Chapman explains Ms. Harvey needs to speak with Attorney Pollock to determine which options she will take. Off record for scheduling.  Back on the record, there was off record discussion in which Mr. Chapman advised Ms. Harvey prefers to appear by Video.  Atty must file request and written consent in advance of hearing.  Mr. Rennicke has no objection.  Court will be in Polk Co. and appear by video and will go through colloquy and have documentation filed in advance.  Bond continues.  Forward Plea Questionnaire, Waiver of Rights and consent to appear by video signed by Ms. Harvey to Judge prior to hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:17 AM Cases 22CF47 and 22CF48 called together.  Defendant Lori J. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Lori J. Harvey appeared by video means with Attorney.  All parties appear via Zoom; Burnett County has an open courtroom.  State assures VR compliance.  Off the record for breakout room for defense, 9:18 AM.  Back on the record 9:25 AM, same appearances as previously noted.  Parties waive in person appearances.  Cases on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of informations, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Discussion of bond- none set in either file.  Status conference set for July 29th at 2pm.

Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Forwarded to Taycheedah via email on 5/24/22.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 03:05 PM Cases 22CF47 and 22CF48 called together.  Defendant Lori J. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Lori J. Harvey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Cases were set for preliminary hearing, but def indicates it intends to waive them.  Both cases proceed to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waivers of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind overs.  State files informations matching complaints.  Atty Chapman asks for separate arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

03:06 PM Cases 20CF91, 20CV32, 20CV33, 22CF47, and 22CF48 called together.  Defendant Lori J. Harvey in court with attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case 20CF91 is on for the second portion of a Sentencing Hearing.  Court makes record.  Victims appear, some by telephone, others in person, wishing to make additional statements.  Defense does not object to hearing statements by video or telephone conferencing; Court will allow.  Victim 1 makes a statement.  Victim 2 makes a statement.  Victim 3 makes a statement.  Court acknowledges receipt of VIS.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI, State proposes 1 correction; Atty Amann proposes no corrections or modifications.  State argues for 6 years probation, with a withheld sentence.  Defense attorney requests that Court take judicial notice of documents 38, 43, 48, 53, and 54; suggests def sign title away to use vehicle for restitution, argues for 73 days jail credit.  Defendant makes a statement.  
Court orders: 
3 years IC; 2 years ES. 
Not eligible for CIP, eligible for SAP, but may not engage in that program until she sits at least 1.5 years IC
Conditions of extended supervision:
The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No use of any prescription medication without approval of 2 doctors concurring that the medication is in her best interest.  No use or possession of alcohol.  Gainful employment.  Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life.  Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored.  $518 court costs.  The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  No contact with any of the victims or their residences.  73 days jail credit.  
Appeal rights provided.  WEDS prepared, explained, and provided to def.  Atty Amann makes record.  Def now qualifies for PD, Atty Amann is released from appointment, def to apply for PD.  $18,000 restitution is stipulated to, but restitution hearing will be set to determine the total restitution.  Restitution hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Status conference on March 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
